meanings.definition: Resembling a sponge in texture or absorbency.
meanings.sent1: The kitchen sponge was spongelike, able to hold a lot of water.
meanings.sent2: The bath sponge felt spongelike against my skin.
meanings.sent3: The spongelike cake soaked up the delicious syrup quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her memory was spongelike, absorbing every detail of the story.
meanings.sent5: The spongelike clouds soaked up the colors of the sunset.

meanings.sent3: The spongelike toy expanded when placed in water.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was spongelike, absorbing knowledge effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist's style was spongelike, taking inspiration from various sources.

meanings.definition: Able to absorb or soak up liquid easily.
meanings.sent1: The paper towel was spongelike, quickly soaking up the spilled juice.
meanings.sent2: The sponge was spongelike, absorbing all the excess water from the sink.
meanings.sent3: The spongelike fabric absorbed the spilled coffee in seconds.
meanings.sent4: His mind was spongelike, absorbing information like a sponge.
meanings.sent5: The ground was spongelike after the heavy rain, soaking up every drop.
